intro: Alsophila borbonica, commonly known as the Bourbon tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery fronds. The plant has a distinctive crown of pinnate fronds that can reach several meters in length. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Alsophila borbonica plays a role in providing habitat and contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystem.
